body:
This needs to be fixed before release.

Diagnosis should start by doing a comparison to the existing other (pycuda-skcuda) implementation as required in #20
maybe you could "unit test" by storing some coefficients from your version?

that's what I mean

On Mon, Oct 22, 2018 at 11:27 AM Edouard Oyallon <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> maybe you could "unit test" by storing some coefficients from your version?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/eickenberg/scattering_transform/issues/2#issuecomment-431925323>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABPwC32pT3oyxlfLCRcy4SRUkXnz19_3ks5ung36gaJpZM4XDMSw>
> .
>

I can not run the fetch_qm7 function, I get 
`Segmentation fault (core dumped)`
I just found out that the problem from the call of function `_pca_align_position` https://github.com/eickenberg/scattering_transform/blob/master/scattering/datasets.py#L193

Problem came from 
https://github.com/eickenberg/scattering_transform/blob/master/scattering/datasets.py#L204
`cov = masked_pos.T.dot(masked_pos)`
fixed replacing by 
` cov = np.dot(np.transpose(masked_pos), masked_pos.copy())`

uuhhh ... that does the same thing:

- `np.transpose(array)` and `array.T` yield the same output (a view with adjusted strides)
- `np.dot(a, b)` is the same as `a.dot(b)`

The only thing that is different is the `copy` for the second argument. I currently don't have any idea why that would make the thing work and why it fails without. Especially because `masked_pos` is a fresh array obtained by masking, it is contiguous, C-ordered, and has nothing weird about it.

I think this might be machine-specific, but in any case, great that you found it and made it work

issue.title: [WIP] 3D: fix filters and get qm7 example working

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body: With this fixed we can reproduce results of the paper.

issue.title: Test coverage

issue.body:
Tests are required for every single function in this codebase.

Rule: If you contributed the code, you are the person being looked to first for the tests. Please make sure your part is covered. Please ask for help.

- [ ] Fixing: https://github.com/eickenberg/scattering_transform/issues/2 (3d MAE)

issue.title: [MAINT] Update license

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body: First, there's another list of authors there. What to do about it? There's also how it should be named (`LICENSE` seems more standard than `licence.txt`). Finally, it doesn't seem to register with GitHub's license-detection mechanism (license box in top right only says `View license`, not `BSD 3-Clause` or whatever it is that we have).

      ~- `* phi_t`: flatten joint along first-order~

### Todo (non-JTFS)

 - [ ] 1. `periodize_filter_fourier`: 
```
which has the effect of `h_t[::k]`, where `h_t = ifft(h_f)`.
````

<hr>

 - [x] 5. ~For `T`, if `average=False`, override and set to `2**J` so it doesn't interfere with subsampling (+ throw warning that it does nothing)~
